runs.comm: full toss on off to begin the chase, but Nicol can't capitalise and mistimes it into the leg side
full outside off at good pace at 141.5kph, swings away after beating the expansive drive
this is fired in on leg, Nicol misses the flick, ball clips the pad and beats the diving Ramdin down leg and races to the fine leg fence
beats him all ends up there, good length ball outside off, Nicol wafted at it without moving the feet and it cut him in half as it nipped back sharply

comes down the track and aggressively pulls behind square leg, the ball slows up as it nears the fence but Pollard chasing after it drops it as he picks it up and inadvertently flings it over the rope, he quickly apologises to Edwards
this is a short ball rearing up towards the throat, Nicol hops and gets bat solidly behind it as he defends to point
first ball is defended to leg

horrible flighted full toss which Guptill tries to launch over the covers, he doesn't time it particularly well but gets it just over the diving mid-off fielder on the edge of the circle, in fact Pollard got a hand to it but he landed very awkwardly and clutches the shoulder in pain. He is going off and this has to raise doubts about the state of the outfield, after Ross Taylor also suffered similar pain earlier
tries to defend a full ball on leg, clips the pad and rolls into the leg side
short and wide down leg and Nicol misses out with the pull but will get a second bite at the cherry
almost bowled, outside off and Nicol goes for an ambitious sweep but makes no contact
guides a full ball outside off to the fielder
dragged very short, sits up and Nicol slaps it off the back foot through the covers to the boundary

Guptill comes forward and inside edges into the pad, rolls to leg and Guptill sets off for a single, initially unaware that the ball is near the bowler's follow-through, but he quickly realises and races back
good length ball outside off and Guptill plays it behind point
this was short outside off and Nicol timed the pull very nicely and the ball rockets to the cow corner boundary
this is slipped down leg past the attempted flick and despite the attempts to distract the umpire with frivolous appeals, the wide is called
half-volley outside off and Nicol misses out as he is beaten for pace
full on leg, beats the attempted swing round the corner and is hit on the pad, rolls fine and they scamper through
full toss on the stumps which Nicol chips down the ground past mid-on and it was timed better than at first glance, reaches the rope with ease
Guptill uses his feet but almost yorks himself and has to dig it out towards long-on
tossed up outside off and Nicol again goes for the sweep, misses and is hit on the pad, Badree lets out a stifled appeal
this is pushed through down leg, Nicol again can't make contact with the sweep and the ball rolls fine off the pad
short and wide, sits up nicely and a player of Guptill's class doesn't miss out on those, punches it through the covers with top timing
waits back in the crease and wristily flips it from middle stump down to long-on

and he has a wicket first ball, it was well down leg and Guptill came down trying to work it but it turned further down leg past the flick and Ramdin did well to whip the bails off after a quick collection, Guptill strained in vain trying to get back but couldn't and New Zealand lose their trump card
tucked fine off the pads straight to fine leg, sets off but is quickly sent back
big appeal for lbw, turns in sharply from outside off but Taylor manages to get just outside the line of off as he tries to work it to leg
gets the bat in front of pad to this delivery turning into middle stump and plays to midwicket
comes down the track but doesn't appear to pick Narine's carrom ball which goes the other way, has to retreat into defence down the pitch
pushed through down leg, clips the pad and rolls fine
fired well down leg past Taylor's slog sweep

this is full and slides straight on, Taylor punches to mid-off and sets off, starts to slip into cruise control halfway through before realising he had to pick the pace up, might have been caught short had the throw hit
fired through on off and Nicol jams it out to backward point who completely lets it through the hands and they run on the misfield
Taylor goes to his release shot, the slog sweep to cow corner, but misses and is hit outside off on the lack leg
chops the short ball through third man, not timed particularly well but nevertheless he achieves the desired result
backs away and exposes all three stumps, it's a good length ball on middle and Taylor connects with the slash and sends it away to the point fence
again gives plenty of room, Badree follows him and he bottom-edges it between his legs
short down leg and flicked away through square leg
tries the delicate reverse paddle but generates no power from it as he gets outside off and the keeper runs round to prevent a single
flicked off the pads through backward square

rocks back and cuts through the covers, they decide to rush back for a second and Dwayne Smith fires a flat, fast throw in which leaves Nicol gasping, but Samuels doesn't collect cleanly to let Nicol off the hook with the batsman well short even after a despairing dive
more good fielding from Smith in the deep running round at backward point, fires a throw towards the bowler's end and stops the batsmen from going for a second
full outside off and Williamson waiting in the crease bottom-edges it behind the stumps to the right of Ramdin, allowing them to sneak a single
waits again and punches uppishly down the ground to Sammy's left, almost a catchable opportunity as Sammy rolled the fingers on it
worked away to deep midwicket
punched off the back foot into the covers
gets forward and driven into the covers
full outside off and Nicol bottom-hands it with a hockey drag flick down to long-on
gets down on a knee and sweeps aerially out towards deep midwicket
rocks back and cuts it behind backward point, slows up near the rope and is dragged back
full outside off and Williamson waits but bottom-edges the cut
comes down the track and gives a bit of room to drive handsomely through extra cover but only for a single
poor ball releases some pressure, short down leg and Nicol gets down on a knee and helps it on its way over the fine leg fielder
chips down the track and clipped down to long-on
bottom-edges the pull from outside off towards the keeper
Sammy gets Williamson with a full toss, he timed it nicely and looked to have got it over Sammy's head but Sammy plucked it out of the air with both hands
bottom-edges his first ball attempting to pull a slower ball from outside off, much like Nicol earlier in the over
that's what he's there for, full on middle in the slot and he picks it up well and gets enough on it to send it over the rope at long-on
beaten outside off as Sammy fires it into the blockhole
gets down to sweep off leg stump but it hits the pad and rolls to fine leg
goes back and forces it towards long-on
almost gets through, that was fired full on middle and Southee stayed back but jammed down on it in time and squeezed it into the off side
goes for a big swing to leg and gets it out to deep midwicket on the bounce
another leg-side wide, the bowling has been very average today
comes down and drills a full ball past the diving bowler Badree to long-off
goes back and pulls it straight over a leaping Badree down the ground and they utilise the placement to make the return journey

and another West Indian bowler strikes with their first delivery, it was full on off but Nicol came down looking to pick up and swing to leg, gets a top edge which flies all the way down to third man who takes a comfortable catch
punches a straight drive down the ground, Latham on debut to take strike
around the wicket to the left-hander, Latham nibbles at his first ball outside off but fortunately misses to avoid a golden duck on debut
gets his first T20I run by coming forward and playing through the in-field out to deep cover
follows Southee to leg with a yorker which gets through him but is well away from leg stump
another terrible delivery, far too many of those today, slower ball is misdirected and slides well down the leg side
full on the stumps and digs it out to third man, the required rate has crossed 15 and New Zealand really have to throw all caution to the wind here to pull this off
Southee tries to swing to leg but his head is looking only at the midwicket fence and not the ball, mistimes it into the pad
doesn't mistime this one! Gets under this and absolutely launches it with immense power and it sails over the long-on boundary! New Zealand need much more of that
again swings to leg, misses and is hit on the pad as the ball turns down leg, they sneak a leg bye

Latham goes for a slog sweep to leg to a ball outside off, he skies it in the air and it falls short, but Simmons running in fires in a rocket throw as the batsmen come back for a couple. This is desperately close, the ball appears to hit the stumps in the same frame as where he makes his ground. Better quality cameras with a faster frame rate might have sent Latham on his way, but he survives for now
rocks back and slaps out to deep point on the fence
comes down the track and again targets the midwicket boundary, doesn't get enough on it and it gets to deep midwicket charging around the rope on the bounce
waits in the crease and heaves across the line into the deep, they take on the fielder's arm and just barely succeed
Southee strikes it towards long-on for a single, New Zealand need plenty of boundaries here and the West Indies are not letting them get them
angling into middle and off from around the wicket due to Bravo's slightly round-arm action, swings to deep midwicket and they pick up a couple
this is shorter and wider outside off, gets some timing on the swing down the ground but finds long-on
takes one hand off the bat as he tries to swing Bravo over the midwicket boundary, had no choice as Bravo cleverly slowed the pace to only 106.7kph
beaten outside off and the West Indies will surely get off to a winning start in this series as the required rate nears 17 per over
comes down and gets a thick outside edge towards backward point who dives but can't quite get to it in time
pushed through across the left-hander outside off and Latham makes no contact with the attempted swing to leg
Latham finally gets a boundary as he connects well with a swing to leg and it gets to the midwicket rope on the bounce
hit away into the covers

that's the end of Southee, had to go for it and perishes in the process, came down the track and aimed to plonk this into the leg-side stands but met with air only and Ramdin completed an easy stumping
and is beaten first ball by a ripping delivery from Narine, pitched outside leg, Oram came forward nervously and groped inside the line as it spun rapidly past the outer edge
Latham moves across outside off and tries to sweep, hits the back of the bat and rolls to third man. Not sure that is really the best option against Edwards

Oram drops a short ball outside off into the covers, thinks of a single before pausing, but Latham is already very far down and tries to turn back but is beaten by a pinpoint direct hit from Darren Sammy running in from point and collecting cleanly before firing off a deadly throw
Oram moves well outside leg, Fidel follows him and he clips it off his hips fine, Oram is also not moving particularly well between the wickets
full in the blockhole and there is little that can be done against that delivery at 90mph other than to dig it out

brilliant throw by Badree, the West Indies have not just out-batted New Zealand, they have comfortably out-fielded them too, Brownlie drove a full ball to wide mid-off and set off knowing full well that he was at the fielder's mercy. Badree on debut went wicketless, so wasn't going to let him off and nails two stumps with Brownlie having given up long before
again very full outside off and dug out to deep cover
Oram hits the first boundary in almost two overs, slams a full ball over long-off with a big backlift after coming down the track

dabbed into the off side, another direct hit but this time the batsman is home. Confusion out there as the players were all set to resume before the umpires, who haven't had a great game, decided to refer it. Only one replay needed to confirm what everyone but the umpires knew

carrom ball snares Narine his third wicket, Nathan McCullum departs for a golden duck, it was on that awkward length on middle and the batsman was just hoping he would make contact - instead it turned well past the bat and struck him on the back leg in front of middle and off
goes back and Bracewell doesn't pick the carrom ball, edged past the diving slip
gets forward and wristily chips it over the bowler's head down to long-on
Oram is defiant in the face of defeat, comes down the track and doesn't really time the big heave to leg all that well but still gets more than enough on it to send it over the fence on the off-side
full outside off and dug away into the leg side, Oram barely limps through for the run, hard to see how he will play tomorrow
Bracewell demonstrates his hitting ability, short on off and he rocks back and biffs it over the midwicket boundary
full on the stumps and punched down the ground
Oram skies this full ball outside off over the ring fielders on the off-side, but gets enough on it for it to bounce over the rope after landing inside just short
times this swing even more poorly than the previous one, which is fortunate for Oram as it means the ball falls short of the deep fielder running in
swings it away to the leg side as the bottom hand comes off and they somehow manage to sneak a second with Oram barely able to run
a bold stroke from Oram, he moves way outside off and gets inside the line of a bumper from Edwards and hooks it off his right shoulder down to the fine leg fence
great catch from Bravo, Oram mistimed another heave to leg and it skied towards long-off, where Bravo raced in and took it low before adding a dive for dramatic effect
